name: Macdonald Holyrood Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: yet again, a fantastic stay, must be macdonalds flagship hotel, excellent service and such a warm welcome.
reviews.title: stunning property, location and more

likes.liked: — you know what you should expect froma macdonald hotel, this one goes much futher.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i do look forward to my next stay,
reviews.title: Brilliant
Don't book hotel for the spa!
reviews.text: I flew to Edinburgh for a 2 night short break, I have stayed in many Macdonald properties and this was top of the league. From the moment I checked in the staff couldn't be more helpful, nothing was too much trouble. I had never been to Edinburgh before and the knowledge of where to go and what to see was excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because it has a spa. Unfortunately the spa is run by inefficient, clueless fools.
reviews.title: Edinburgh excellent experience!

likes.liked: — Warm, well located for old town and things to do.
likes.disliked: — Nouveau cuisine - not good for larger apetites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start with they charged my credit card twice, a mistake which could easily have been rectified you'd have thought, over 2 months, 8 phone calls, and 3 e mails later, I'm still awaiting the refund.
reviews.title: Dissapointed by Service...

likes.disliked: — Staff, terrible TV's in room, breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service we received at this hotel was excellent, in particular the Concierge was extremely friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed an evening meal in the dining room. On the date we visited, the dining room was offering an excellent menu at a special rate and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal. Our waitress was extremely friendly and judged our personalities very well, so was able to make us feel very welcome and special. Our room was at the side of the hotel, very quiet, beautifully maintained and extremely comfortable. We had two comfortable lounge chairs and a television. This hotel is situated on Holyrood Road which made it perfect for visiting Holyrood Palace, the Scottish Parliament Building and The Royal Mile, all well worth a visit. Edinburgh Castle is right at the top of The Royal Mile and there are museums, bars and restaurants all the way from bottom to top. We were delighted to see a Taxi rank right across the road from the hotel, as well as an autoteller and a small Tesco store just 50 yards from the hotel. The hotel is approximately a 15 minute walk from Princes Street. The Consierge parked our car for us on Friday night and returned it to us when we left. There is a charge for parking so check before you go. Well worth it to avoid the stress of parking in a big city. The only fault I could find with this hotel was the locatiion of the lounge which is situated just inside the main revolving door and opposite the Reception Desk. Very nice but a little impersonal. I would stay again, at this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent staff and perfect location for visiting the old town of Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I find the hotel satisfactory although it has already aged, and the room decorations are old-fashioned and may already be dusty. What I like most is the marble flooring of the bathroom. What I don't like is the carpet. And the rooms at the ground floor do not have sound insulation. I hear everything happening in the corridor. One more positive point: the newsletter coming in through the door every morning but the on my last day it breezed in with such speed that I woke up. Internet connection was also available, but bring your own cable to avail of free services.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this wonderful hotel just before Christmas.It is situated just off the Royal Mile but only about 10 mins from train station.The reception is very plush and the staff are friendly,attentive and informative.The room we had was very clean,large and quiet even though it looked on the main road.We never ate here as Edinburgh has many eating establishments so cant comment on the food but we used the gym and pool which were both excellent.Overall a fantastic Hotel which we will use again.Just one more thing,while we were there,there was Christmas parties going on in the hotel all weekend and we never heard any noise.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel with excellent facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Just stayed for one night and initial impressions were good. A warm welcome at check in and quickly up to the room. Very spacious but I think this was because it was a disabled room. On closer inspection, the room was very tired with stained carpet, lots of pain scuffs on the walls and ceiling and faded varnish in the bathroom. There was a safe in the wardrobe which was too small to fit a laptop in, but that didn't matter as the safe was not fixed to the wall and could be taken out so not secure at all.
reviews.title: OK, but rooms are tired and some of the service was lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Having a drink at the bar was nice on the squashy sofas but service was painfully slow.
reviews.title: Just make sure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: We spent two nights in the Macdonald Holyrood Hotel and had a great time. It's in a great location (a few blocks from the start of the Royal Mile) and the staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Holy Holyrood! And great bartenders too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our favourite night was drinking at the lobby bar talking to the two bartenders. Even though I was hungover the next day walking around Edinburgh Castle it was totally worth it. It's friendly staff like these guys that make your stay memorable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great service & great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is also close walking distance from some of the local pubs (we spent another night in the World's End Pub nearby).
reviews.title: very good value and location

likes.disliked: — Guests swimming after sauna and steamroom without showering

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I can't wait for our next visit to Edinburgh and it will definitely be in the Holyrood Hotel.
reviews.title: Short break in Edinburgh

likes.disliked: — Restaurant Management unwilling to put themselves out for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Holyrood at the beginning of December for a short break, taking our 8 month old daughter on her first trip to Edinburgh. We were very impressed with the standard of the hotel and found all staff to be very helpful. The rooms were large and clean and the breakfast was wonderful. Couldnt have asked for more.
reviews.title: ideal hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was so easy to check into, the man at reception was wonderful.
reviews.title: Amazing!
Loved it
reviews.text: The room was lovely and clean, and everything was just as it should be - with a nice bottle of sparkling water waiting on us - also had some coffee's tea and milk there to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every one was friendly and it gave an overall nice welcoming feeling.
reviews.title: A place to stay to treat yourself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Only reason I marked the Sleep Quality down was I could hear a near by club all night - which on a friday night you expect in Edinburgh - nothing to do with the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Very Friendly Stay and Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days in Feb. Have to say best hotel ive ever stayed in. The staff are fantastic, nothing is too much trouble. always a friendly hello during the day. food was top notch, brekkie great and we had dinner one night - delish. the hotel itself, is clean warm very central and just a short stroll from the crags where theres a lovely walk. we were lucky with the weather it was dry and bright but cold. the hotel is 10 minutes walk to the city centre and i have to say that we just loved Edinburgh. The people are what make a place i think and both the Hotel and Edinburgh have it all. highly recommend this hotel. loved it.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Birthday trip for husband. Travelled with 1 and 2 year old. Room excellent size for four, adapted double I believe. Complimentary glass of champagne for us for his birthday. Ambience and look of hotel could quite easily be a five star. It borders on boutique style with little extras in room like robes and bottled water. Husband enjoyed spa treatment and pool relaxes you after a hard day pounding the cobbles of such a beautiful city. The pull back to Edingburgh will be the amazing city, the magical culture vib and this beautiful hotel. The staff work hard to make you feel welcome. Very good breakfast. Thank you to hotel for making a trip, memorable, comfortable and unforgetable. Keep up the good work for others to enjoy.
reviews.title: excellent location,service,value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was slightly apprehensive on booking this hotel, as a secret hotel at the last minute, as the price for a 4* Edinburgh hotel seemed very good value – even though thanks to TripAdvisor I was able to work out just which top secret hotel it was prior to purchasing. Thankfully I was very pleasantly surprised and the TripAdvisor rating was spot on. I stayed with my wife for a Saturday night stay in a standard double room.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a last minute deal

likes.disliked: — the tv was too small for this quality establishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is just off the Royal Mile, about 2 minutes walk from the Scottish Parliament, Holyrood Castle and Dynamic Earth.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points:
reviews.title: Great hotel, great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: - Location is good, and if you enjoy a refreshing walk the 10-15 minute stroll all the way up the Royal Mile to the castle would be enjoyable. If I needed to go to the Scottish Parliament on business then the hotel is ideally placed. There is also a Pizza Express next door for good quality, good value Italian food.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

likes.liked: — The staff - all friendly (even at breakfast when obviously under it!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just experienced the most fantastic break that we could not fault in any way....the service was incredible,the staff were authentically friendly,the room was fantastic with the most comfortable bed...but it was the little things,the attention to detail that made our stay so special and such an incredible bargain...private butler on the 6th floor,free champagne and canapes reception,bed turned down with water and slippers stratigically placed,classical music turned on to greet you at night,microphone in the toilet so you can still listen to the telly whilst having a bath,fresh fruit in your room,free bottled water,the most amazing food from the opius restaurant...the list is endless....we shall most def.return!!!
reviews.title: superb in every way!!!!

likes.disliked: — some chairs could do with replacing in the lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay on a city break in Edinburgh. The location (just off the Holyrood end of the Royal Mile, almost next door to the Scottish Parliament) makes it an excellent base for exploring Edinburgh, and the large, comfortable rooms with particularly excellent beds are just as good for relaxing in.
reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable, superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Macdonald is stylish, modern, and confidently upmarket - service is warm and friendly and the hotel feels efficient and well-run. Everything's clean, efficient and well-designed, and the atmosphere is one of laid-back charm.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Holyrood on a last minute dinner, b&b package. We were going to a concert and therefore asked if we could swap dinner for lunch. This was no problem and we enjoyed a very tasty lunch.
reviews.title: Great deal via Secret hotel deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a fantastic location - just off the royal mile, beside the Scottish parliament building - and was superb value for money. Booking late, about 48 hours before we arrived, we managed to get a classic double room plus breakfast for £100. Not incredibly cheap but the room was large and very clean with a lovely bathroom and shower. The service on the reception and valet parking was very friendly and informative, and the breakfast was fantastic - a cooked breakfast as requested along with a buffet of cold meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, cereals, fruits, muffins etc etc. Really top class
reviews.title: Classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very impressed that a hotel located so centrally and priced so reasonably could deliver so well. Staff were polite even at the bar at 3am, and the complimentary nibbles of bbq almonds, pesto breadsticks and olives were appreciated
reviews.title: Outstanding Meeting Facilities and Superb Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Thanks to brilliant oranization of important client meeing. Very professional and accomadating staff organised a highly successful day at the Macdonald Holyroad Hotel. Very nice conference room, ecellent technical equipment, refreshments and lunch.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Most recommendable meeting and conference option in Edinburgh.
reviews.title: A smart & well served hotel with all the amenities you could want.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked this hotel in advance for a weekend break with my wife. Just before staying in the hotel I saw some negative reviews on tripadvisor. I needn't have worried. The room was excellent and very clean. The staff, especially those in the restaurant, were extremely polite, friendly and efficient. The food was very good and the service was quick and helpful.
reviews.title: Thankyou so much for making my parents anniversary so special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: First the positives; the hotel is well located near Scottish Parliament and the Old Town (Royal mile etc), there is a good spa and the breakfast is terrific. The cold options are on the buffet, hot food is cooked to order using good ingredients, sadly the coffee is not so good. Now the negatives. On checking in I was incorrectly told that there was a charge for the internet (in fact wired access is free in the rooms, wifi is available for a fee). The room in which I stayed on the first floor (107) had not been well cleaned or checked; the bed was not properly made (half of the mattress topper was on the floor between the two twin beds) and the duvet cover had stains. The TV remote control did not work and there were other niggles including faulty lighting. But it was after midnight, I had just returned from dinner with colleagues, I was tired and did not want to relocate to another room or wait for the the room to be serviced so decided to make do. On checking out I pointed out the problems with the room, only to be told that I should have complained on checking in! There was no apology nor did the check-out assistant seem unduly concerned. This is potentially a very good hotel that is let down by poor maintenance and badly trained front desk staff.
reviews.title: Great location and breakfast, shame about the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Macdonald Holyrood Hotel on a romantic break with my partner. The room (on the 6th Floor) was nice and tidy but the air conditioner didn't work and therefore the room was cold for the whole two days - which completely spoiled the visit and meant that the time in our room couldn't be enjoyed.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Terribly Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the hotel because of a recommendation but we found the restaurant service to be so far below adequate that we wouldn't visit again. For dinner, we waited more than 20 minutes to have our order taken and had to repeatedly ask the waiters what was happening. At breakfast, they constantly forgot what we had ordered and we had to remind them - and even then, the orders came our wrong. It was just a lack of management and organisation becaus the hotel restaurant was not even a quarter full.
reviews.title: Good standard business hotel with excellent leisure facilities let down by restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: It's a shame because the hotel is quite nice and we would have visited again if the service had been half decent.
reviews.title: Excellent Spa Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got what I thought was a very reasonable deal of £300 for 4 nights B&B for a couple. The room was very spacious, view was of an office building but not overbearing, comfortable with good quality fixtures apart from the TV set which was very poor (Scotland goes digital this year so maybe that's awaiting an upgrade). We went by train as we planned to stay in the city centre and didn't need a car. £7 taxi from the station
reviews.title: Perfect for a weekend away

description: The luxury 4 star Macdonald Holyrood Hotel is the perfect venue whether for business or pleasure, you are assured of an unforgettable stay. Our team of professional and welcoming staff will offer you a high standard of service to match the luxurious surroundings. Step outside and enjoy Edinburgh on your doorstep: with the Palace of Holyroodhouse, The Queen's official residence in Scotland; Edinburgh Castle; The Royal Mile; Princes Street; Our Dynamic Earth and much, much more - all within a few minutes walk.
